chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas L Longacre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $100.00 per month commencing 08-01-2016 or serve 44 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

With Huber release for standard conditions.  2 days credit. Commencing FORTHWITH.  Defendant to report to the Huber Facility following court.
Consecutive to: any other case
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant.

Perform alcohol assessment and follow through.
ATTEND Victim Impact Panel on 03-02-2016 or serve 20 days Huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez  for Jess Martinez.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.    The defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #1:

HUBER:  180 days, w/Standard Release Conditions (Apply Credit - 2 Days). (consecutive to any other case). Sentence to begin forthwith.  Defendant to report to the Huber Facility following Court.

FINE: $1544.00 (to pay $100.00 per month commencing (8/1/16) or serve 44 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment of fine);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00, to be paid at $100.00 per month consecutive to payment of fine.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

D/L REVOCATION: 24 MONTHS;

IGNITION INTERLOCK: 24 months;

Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on:  (3/2/16). Defendant to serve 20 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.   

Count #3:

HUBER: 6 MONTHS, with standard release conditions. (CONCURRENT TO COUNT #1)

COSTS: $243.00 (to be paid at $100.00 per month consecutive to payments in count #1).

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00, to be paid at $100.00 per month consecutive to payment of fines/costs in count #1 and Costs in Count #2.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-24-2016 10:30 am

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez for Jess Martinez.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Court calls the case to address the motion to dismiss filed by Attorney Martinez.  Attorney Hirt presents her argument as to why the charge should not be dismissed.  Attorney Martinez presents his argument.  The Court denies the motion to dismiss for reasons stated on the record.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Motion hearing at 02-16-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court with attorney Nick Martinez for Jess Martinez.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the motion to dismiss.  State is not prepared to take up this matter. There is a speedy trial demand filed. Attorney Martinez withdraws the speedy trial demand.  Court sets this motion for next week Tuesday at 8:30, subject to be rescheduled if other possible trials.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Notice and Motion to Dismiss filed by Atty Nicholas Martinez
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person at 02-16-2016 08:15 am
Jury status hearing at 02-11-2016 10:30 am

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez for Jess Martinez.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez requests a speedy trial demand on the record and the Court sets the matter for trial.    The Court grants Huber Bailee Status.  Jury status hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Hearing at 12-21-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court, in custody, with attorney Jess Martinez.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez to advise the Court how the case will proceed at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 11-30-2015 03:30 pm

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez for Jess Martinez.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez advises the Court the Defendant has recently been charged on 15CM2126 and requesting additional time for negotiations on the other case.  The Court sets the matter for another jury status prior to the trial.  Attorney Martinez requests the Court modify the bail to include Huber bailee status with SCRAM monitoring.  The State objects to the bail motion.  The Court denies the request for bail modification.  Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Hearing at 11-24-2015 09:30 am

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant to have no huber priviliges.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court. Defendant to only be released to WCS to have the SCRAM monitoring placed on.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole Masnica for Atty. Jess Martinez.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.
